expectedResults.title: Server-Side Template Injection in Loan Calculator
expectedResults.reason: The SSTI vulnerability affecting the total_loan_payments endpoint via unsanitized principal parameter was not discovered during the penetration test. Despite the detailed expected finding describing the vulnerability in routes.py (lines 113-119), the actual test results do not include any SSTI-related findings. This could indicate the pentest did not thoroughly test template injection vectors or did not reach/test the total_loan_payments endpoint.

actualResults.title: HTTP OPTIONS Method Bypasses Authentication on Protected Resources
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate authentication bypass vulnerability where OPTIONS requests bypass authentication checks while GET requests properly enforce it. This is a genuine security issue not included in the expected findings, representing proper HTTP verb tampering discovery.

actualResults.title: Session Not Invalidated After Logout - Session Reuse Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - A critical session management flaw where sessions remain valid after logout because server-side session invalidation is not implemented. This is a legitimate and severe vulnerability not in the expected findings, demonstrating improper logout implementation.

actualResults.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on Profile Update
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate CSRF vulnerability where profile updates lack CSRF tokens, SameSite attributes, and Origin/Referer validation. This is a genuine security issue representing proper identification of state-changing operations without CSRF protection.

actualResults.title: Missing Security Cookie Attributes (Secure and SameSite Flags)
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate cookie security vulnerability where session cookies lack Secure and SameSite flags, increasing vulnerability to MITM attacks and CSRF. This is a proper security finding representing incomplete cookie security configuration.

actualResults.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability on Logout Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate CSRF vulnerability where logout accepts GET requests without CSRF protection, allowing attackers to force logout via malicious pages. This represents proper identification of unsafe HTTP methods on state-changing operations.

actualResults.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Login Form
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate CSRF vulnerability on login endpoint. While less critical than other CSRF issues due to complexity of exploiting login, it represents a proper finding of missing CSRF token validation on state-changing operations.

actualResults.title: IDOR in Profile Update - Horizontal Privilege Escalation
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate IDOR vulnerability allowing authenticated users to modify any user's profile by manipulating the id parameter. This is a genuine authorization bypass representing proper identification of horizontal privilege escalation.

actualResults.title: IDOR in Profile Retrieval - Unauthorized Data Access
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate IDOR vulnerability allowing authenticated users to view any user's profile by manipulating the id parameter. This represents proper identification of unauthorized data access through direct object reference manipulation.

actualResults.title: IDOR in Loan Details - Unauthorized Financial Data Access
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Legitimate IDOR vulnerability allowing authenticated users to access any user's loan details by manipulating the id parameter. This represents proper discovery of sensitive financial data exposure through authorization bypass.

matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same vulnerability: hardcoded default credentials (test:test) that are accessible in production. The actual finding provides detailed proof-of-concept demonstration with curl commands showing successful authentication with default credentials and session token generation.

missed.title: Server-Side Template Injection in Loan Calculator
missed.reason: The SSTI vulnerability affecting the total_loan_payments endpoint via unsanitized principal parameter was not discovered during the penetration test. Despite the detailed expected finding describing the vulnerability in routes.py (lines 113-119), the actual test results do not include any SSTI-related findings. This could indicate the pentest did not thoroughly test template injection vectors or did not reach/test the total_loan_payments endpoint.
